page.title: 02Melling and Arkholme. Cont..
page.content: Each village has an old Primary school, Melling with a headmistress and a headmaster in Arkholme. There have been new classrooms and a kitchen built on in Melling in the last twenty years but Arkholme is still waiting for some more modernisation. Many of the inhabitants of both the villages are not local born people.They have moved here for a pleasant lifestyle while they work in towns or they have retired here. There is a garage /petrol station in both villages and a shop/ post office in Arkholme. Melling has no shop at all other than the garage. A railway bridge crosses the river but the stations are closed.Carnforth is the nearest one to Arkholme and Wennington for Melling on the Yorkshire line. The R.Lune provides abundantly for salmon fishing and bird watching.
